column4: it's totally possible they're using a transparent proxy (one that doesn't tell servers where it's forwarding the content on to). In that case whatsmyip wouldn't be able to tell your real IP. I've got to say though, it's pretty rare because it does have the tendency to confuse and annoy users
Ah. Yes. Blimey... They could be proxying your traffic several times over to make sure you're not looking at something "illegal"
I can connect on port 2222 but nothing happens when I'm connected
right, *exactly*!!
you're sure you're forwarding correctly?
positive. and I tried two different routers, and on many ports.. even with telnet + netcat -l
I don't think no-ip/dyndns is going to help at all. Your address is fine and that's all they deal with.
have you tried a higher port like 39713 (just a random example)
not that high, but i did try 8080
try a bit higher then and let me know the port... Some ISPs do block incoming connections on lower known service ports to stop people hosting things
if you have a minute, try this:      telnet 118.198.214.191 8080                    I just ran " netcat -l -p 8080 "
i got your "HELO", but then you got disconnected, right?
I disconnected but yes, I wrote HELO
right, any incoming connection gets disconnected after the first line, so SSH never has a chance; it gets owned right away
i really think it's my ISP

if you have (or get) another server you *could* ssh to it from your box there, tunnelling a port back to your computer (over the SSH connection) and then connect through the external machine... It's a bit of a faff but it wouldn't be too expensive to hire a shell on another machine
it's actually how I connect to my home server. Rather than having incoming connections here, I use my webserver to proxy any connections
Reverse tunnel? That's how I do it right now........ :(
you mean ssh -N -R2222:localhost:22 localhost, right?
something like that, yeah
yep, that's what I'm doing to my webserver. I thought the problem was my crappy router, so I used that as a workaround. Then, i bought a new router. Same problem. Thx though :)!
